column4: is there a highly technical channel for ubuntu possibly with maintainers/developers?
i need to talk to someone who maintains the mkinitramfs package
working fine here - want to explain the issue ?
when you drop back the shell, what happens to the process ID
it stays in the process table indefinitely, forever, and goes nowhere
can you truss that process ID ?
this happens when i attempt to install a kernel via apt
ok - so you're not trying to build an initrd, your installing a kernel
what is the command you are using to run it manually
is it with 1 kernel package, or everyone you've done
this happens on EVERY package unless that update-initramfs parameter is seto to no
so every kernel package you've installed has had this problem
yes, unless i set that parameter to no
ok - have you tried this on a clean install also, ( a re-install since)
trying to not do that if I can
ok, only asking as so many people are working fine, I wondered if you install may have an issue
